content: On October 23, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched the World Series title by defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6, marking the franchise's first championship since relocating to Atlanta. Tom Glavine delivered a stunning performance, pitching eight scoreless innings and earning the World Series MVP honors. The Braves won the game 1-0, thanks to a critical RBI single by David Justice, solidifying their place in baseball history with this long-awaited victory.
